Q3 FOCUS Independent work is going mainstream <http://www.mbopartners.com/state-of-independence/independent-work-goes-mainstream.html>, but many organizations are still playing catch-up on their IC talent management strategy. That’s why we are launching an educational campaign <http://www.prweb.com/releases/2012/10/prweb10023080.htm> across the country, while also introducing our first, free Contractor Engagement Quarterly. Each quarter, we’ll share the hot topics, insight on legal cases, noteworthy blogs and white papers featuring best practices for ensuring happy, engaged contract talent. By the decade’s end, half of all U.S. workers may be engaged independent of a single employer. Is your company ready?
Jay Lash Vice President, Market Strategies Connect with Jay <http://www.linkedin.com/in/jaylash>
FEATURED BLOG POST IC Misclassification Risk: It’s About the Right Engagement Programs Gene Zaino, CEO - MBO Partners I have been leading the charge in supporting independent contractors (ICs) for more than a few decades. I have seen the good, the bad, and the ugly issues from all perspectives, including the contractors, the clients, and the regulators. Here are a few words that summarize my observations. Read more here.
TESTIMONIAL “Initially when we started working with MBO over eight years ago it was to mitigate the risk associated with the Independent Contractors we deploy to our federal clients. Now we have learned we can depend on MBO because it has proven to be an effective way for us to engage Independent Contractors. The Contractors seem to be happy with the service they get, the business sees it as a streamlined way to get their talent to work and we still maintain our accepted vendor procurement practices.” Walter Claytor Associate Buyer Booz Allen Hamilton
